intro: Narcissus linnaeanus var. robustus, commonly known as the robust daffodil, is a perennial bulbous plant native to southern Europe. It features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers with a bright yellow corona and a white or pale yellow perianth. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with strap-like, grassy leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, blooming in early spring. This variety is valued for its hardiness and ability to naturalize over time.
